questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 29159

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Hi, I’m Jeremy. I went to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida with my family last summer. It was my favourite vacation. It was a long trip. Since my mother was afraid of flying, we travelled by my dad’s camper. There are four main parks at Walt Disney World: The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and Animal Kingdom. We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there.

The fireworks display was ......  and the holiday was a breath-taking experience for me.

A) typical
B) ordinary
C) expected
D) wonderful
E) unremarkable
A B C D E

We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there. The fireworks display was ......  and the holiday was a breath-taking experience for me. A) typical B) ordinary C) expected D) wonderful E) unremarkable A B C D E

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.
Hi, I’m Jeremy. I went to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida with my family last summer. It was my favourite vacation. It was a long trip. Since my mother was afraid of flying, we travelled by my dad’s camper. There are four main parks at Walt Disney World: The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and Animal Kingdom. We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there.
The fireworks display was ......  and the holiday was a breath-taking experience for me.

Read the reference letter for Boris below and answer the question.

Boris has been working with me as an internship student for seven months in an international company. During the intern program, he fulfilled all his responsibilities on time and made a great deal of progress on professional life.

Thanks to his critical thinking and problem-solving skills, I believe that you will have many commercial deals with customers abroad. He has very good oral and written communication skills. He is always inquisitive and eager to learn new things about the professions and skills related to the job. He will adapt quickly to the new environment because he is open to change and has respect for others.

I highly recommend him for the opportunity that you have available. I believe that he will do his best for your company to increase the company’s commercial profit.

Best Regards

Choose the option that is NOT correct about Boris?

A) Boris always learns new things about the job.
B) He has critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
C) He is always aware of his responsibilities.
D) He will do his best for the new company.
E) He can’t stand learning new things related to the job.
A B C D E

E) Whenever you are available, you can visit me.

Jill: …… Neil: You don’t enjoy cold weather, do you? A) Which one do you prefer, going hitch-hiking or swimming in the ocean? B) I would not like to spend all our money on a holiday. C) I would never say no to a short break from looking after the children. D) Would you prefer to rent a cottage or stay in a hotel? E) I would rather hit the beach for sunbathing than go snowboarding. A B C D E
question:
Choose the correct option to complete the dialogue.
Neil: Where shall we go for our holiday, Jill?
Jill: How about the Maldives? It’s always sunny there and having good time is guaranteed.
Neil: I prefer having a winter holiday this year. Have you seen this magazine ad for an all-inclusive Alps holiday?
Jill: ……
Neil: You don’t enjoy cold weather, do you?
options: Which one do you prefer, going hitch-hiking or swimming in the ocean?
I would not like to spend all our money on a holiday.
I would never say no to a short break from looking after the children.
Would you prefer to rent a cottage or stay in a hotel?
I would rather hit the beach for sunbathing than go snowboarding.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53493

Read the text and answer the question.

The famous author, Stephen King, was broke and struggling when he first started writing. He received sixty rejections before selling his first short story, The Glass Floor, for $35. He was pursuing his goals while he was also working multiple jobs to support his family. In his journey, his wife supported him a lot. Whenever he became desperate or demotivated, she helped him stand up and persevere to go on writing. His iconic thriller book Carrie, which he submitted when he was twenty years old, was rejected by thirty publishers. Despite all the rejections and curveballs that life tossed at him, he never gave up and he could finally find an audience for his writings. Since then, he has published more than fifty books that all became worldwide bestsellers.

It is clear from the passage that …… .

A) Stephen King started writing when he started high school
B) He was having financial difficulties in the early years of his career
C) His wife supported the family financially while he was writing
D) His book, Carrie, became an iconic thriller as soon as he submitted it
E) He wouldn’t have achieved his goals if he had been rejected one more time
A B C D E

questionText: The famous author, Stephen King, was broke and struggling when he first started writing. He received sixty rejections before selling his first short story, The Glass Floor, for $35 . He was pursuing his goals while he was also working multiple jobs to support his family. In his journey, his wife supported him a lot. Whenever he became desperate or demotivated, she helped him stand up and persevere to go on writing. His iconic thriller book Carrie , which he submitted when he was twenty years old, was rejected by thirty publishers. Despite all the rejections and curveballs that life tossed at him, he never gave up and he could finally find an audience for his writings. Since then, he has published more than fifty books that all became worldwide bestsellers. Which sentence cannot be the main idea of the passage? A) Winners never quit and quitters never win. B) If you don’t try, you can’t be successful. C) It doesn’t matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop. D) The most certain way to success is always to try one more time. E) It always seems impossible until it’s done by someone else. A B C D E
question:
The famous author, Stephen King, was broke and struggling when he first started writing. He received sixty rejections before selling his first short story,  *The Glass Floor, for $35*. He was pursuing his goals while he was also working multiple jobs to support his family. In his journey, his wife supported him a lot. Whenever he became desperate or demotivated, she helped him stand up and persevere to go on writing. His iconic thriller book  *Carrie*, which he submitted when he was twenty years old, was rejected by thirty publishers. Despite all the rejections and curveballs that life tossed at him, he never gave up and he could finally find an audience for his writings. Since then, he has published more than fifty books that all became worldwide bestsellers.

Which sentence  *cannot*  be the main idea of the passage?
options: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
If you don’t try, you can’t be successful.
It doesn’t matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
The most certain way to success is always to try one more time.
It always seems impossible until it’s done by someone else.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53498

Read the following extracts from a diary which was written by a 21-year-old Turkish officer, Naci, who fought and died in the Gallipoli Campaign. Which of the statements below is wrong according to it?

‘‘I ate a loaf of bread with yoghurt, and drank tea. I slept for a while, and when I woke up, my adjutant delivered an order. He wanted soldiers to wash their feet and the injured ones should get their feet immersed in the salty water. There were over 30 soldiers with wounded feet. Some of them were really in bad condition. However, there was nothing that could be done.’

‘‘Meals were not brought tonight; soldiers were given cheese. ’’

‘‘The city was charming but gloomy when we arrived. There was nothing apart from the soldiers, cars and animals on the white and dusty streets of the city. Few shops, two restaurants, one or two coffee houses were open. All the remaining shops were closed. When the houses were occupied by the army, there were a few people who insisted on staying at their own places.’’

A) Wounded soldiers couldn’t get a proper medical care.
B) Food and subsistence of the soldiers were poor.
C) The city was almost deserted when the soldiers arrived.
D) There was noone left who stay in their houses.
E) Almost all the shops in the city were closed.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53503

Read the passage and answer the following question.

Marie Curie was a famous Polish scientist who was born in 1867 in Warsaw. Both her father and mother were teachers and they had six children. In the 19th century, typhus and tuberculosis used to be common diseases. When she was 7, her sister died of typhus. When she was 12, she lost her mother because of tuberculosis. Marie used to be a bright child and successful at school. In those times, women wouldn’t go to university. She had to go abroad and earn her living by herself there. She worked as a governess for a few years. Then, she began studying at the Sorbonne University and got a degree in Physics and Maths in four years’ time. She married to another scientist, Pierre Curie and they devoted their lives to science, investigating radioactive elements. In 1902, they found radium and were awarded the Nobel Prize for Physics. In the following years, Marie was also given the Nobel Prize for Chemistry. Due to being exposed to radiation so much, she had leukemia and died in 1934.

Which of the following is NOT about Marie Curie’s determination and success?

A) She used to be successful at school despite the tragedies she experienced.
B) She went abroad and worked as a governess to earn her living and study.
C) She gained degrees in both Physics and Maths in four years’ time.
D) She married to another great scientist, Pierre Currie and they had a daughter.
E) She devoted her life to science and had two Nobel Prizes.
A B C D E

While Chuck Noland was flying to Australia, his plane crashed. He found himself on a very small and deserted island as the only survivor. He struggled hard to survive but he also faced the emotional challenge of being alone. His only friend on the island was a volleyball on which he made a face with his bleeding hand. As days turned into months and then years, the hard-nosed businessman who lived for the moment matured and seemed to learn to live in the moment. He learned patience.

When the plane crashed, he ...... . 

 

A) learned patience 
B) was flying to Australia 
C) worked for a delivery company 
D) worked too much and had to travel overseas 
E) was eventually rescued by a ship
A B C D E

Sue has always enjoyed going skiing. (I) One day, when she saw some people snowboarding, she decided to give it a try. (II) It was easier than she had expected. (V) It was then that she realised what a great sport it is, and now she’d rather go snowboarding than skiing.

B)  II
C)  III
D)  IV
E)  V
A B C D E

(IV) She hates failing at any sport, so she continued trying and she finally managed to go all the way down a slope without an accident. questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53504

Read the paragraph and answer the question.

Pablo Picasso, regarded as one of the greatest and most influential artists of the 20th century, was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist and stage designer. He was born in Málaga, Spain, on October 25, 1881. When he was a child, his father began teaching him to draw and paint. His drawing skills had surpassed his father’s when he turned thirteen years old. His works shaping the direction of modern and contemporary art through the decades were formed from the naturalism of his childhood through Cubism, Surrealism, and beyond.

Picasso’s works were matured from …… .

A) the influence of the artists of the 20th century
B) his father’s drawing and painting skills
C) the naturalism of his childhood through Cubism, Surrealism, and beyond
D) the skills kept in his mysterious inner world that nobody has
E) the impacts of the modern and contemporary art through the decades
A B C D E

Sultan Ahmed Mosque, also known as the Blue Mosque because of its blue interior design, was built between 1609 and 1616 years by Sedefkar Mehmet Aga. ...... . The colorful brightness in the Blue Mosque, its fancy walls decorated with blue tiles, its 6 minarets and unique appearance made it the silhouette of Istanbul. Just like many other mosques, it also comprises a tomb of the founder, a madrasa and a hospice.

A) Sultan Ahmed asked Mehmet Aga to build a mosque that could compete with magnificent monuments such as Hagia Sophia
B) He completed it in seven years with unique decorations that differentiate the mosque from the others
C) The mosque was planned by many architects, but Mehmet Aga was selected for that job
D) He was aware of the fact that it would cost a fortune at the time the mosque was built
E) Before planning the mosque, he examined the architecture of that time
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15180

Read the short biography of the artist Vincent Van Gogh to put the paragraphs into correct order.

I. When he was 33, Van Gogh moved to Paris where he lived with his brother Theo. In Paris, Van Gogh befriended the Impressionists and lightened his colour palette. His later works changed into images of Paris, flowers, portraits, and self-portraits. 

II. While in the asylum he painted 150 paintings before he was released at the age of 37. The same year he shot himself in the chest while painting in a wheat field.  He died two days later with his brother at his side and was buried in France.

III. Two years later, Van Gogh moved from Paris to Arles dreaming of an artist community.  Artist Paul Gauguin joined him, but they could have never achieved the dream. When Gauguin left him, Van Gogh cut off his ear due to frustration. Struggling with mental issues, he stayed in an asylum in Saint Remy.

IV. Vincent Van Gogh was born in Holland in 1853 and became one of the most well-known and influential artists of the 19th century. He tried several jobs including a preacher before deciding to become an artist at the age of twenty-seven. He painted dark portrays of peasants at work.

A) IV - I - III - II
B) III - I - II - IV
C) II - III - I - IV
D) IV - III - I - II
E) I - II - III - IV
A B C D E
questionText: Read the short biography of the artist Vincent Van Gogh to put the paragraphs into correct order. I. When he was 33, Van Gogh moved to Paris where he lived with his brother Theo. In Paris, Van Gogh befriended the Impressionists and lightened his colour palette. His later works changed into images of Paris, flowers, portraits, and self-portraits. II. While in the asylum he painted 150 paintings before he was released at the age of 37. The same year he shot himself in the chest while painting in a wheat field.  He died two days later with his brother at his side and was buried in France. III. Two years later, Van Gogh moved from Paris to Arles dreaming of an artist community.  Artist Paul Gauguin joined him, but they could have never achieved the dream. When Gauguin left him, Van Gogh cut off his ear due to frustration. Struggling with mental issues, he stayed in an asylum in Saint Remy. IV. Vincent Van Gogh was born in Holland in 1853 and became one of the most well-known and influential artists of the 19th century. He tried several jobs including a preacher before deciding to become an artist at the age of twenty-seven. He painted dark portrays of peasants at work. A) IV - I - III - II B) III - I - II - IV C) II - III - I - IV D) IV - III - I - II E) I - II - III - IV A B C D E
question:
Read the short biography of the artist Vincent Van Gogh to put the paragraphs into correct order. 

I. When he was 33, Van Gogh moved to Paris where he lived with his brother Theo. In Paris, Van Gogh befriended the Impressionists and lightened his colour palette. His later works changed into images of Paris, flowers, portraits, and self-portraits. 

II. While in the asylum he painted 150 paintings before he was released at the age of 37. The same year he shot himself in the chest while painting in a wheat field. He died two days later with his brother at his side and was buried in France.

III. Two years later, Van Gogh moved from Paris to Arles dreaming of an artist community. Artist Paul Gauguin joined him, but they could have never achieved the dream. When Gauguin left him, Van Gogh cut off his ear due to frustration. Struggling with mental issues, he stayed in an asylum in Saint Remy.

IV. Vincent Van Gogh was born in Holland in 1853 and became one of the most well-known and influential artists of the 19th century. He tried several jobs including a preacher before deciding to become an artist at the age of twenty-seven. He painted dark portrays of peasants at work.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53509

Order the sentences to make a meaningful paragraph.

I- Bilginer first acted in a theater group when he was a high school student, and won his first award at an inter-high school competition in 1970.

II- He went to England to study at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts, and from 1980 to 1993, he performed on stage and on TV series in England.

III- He won the Best Actor award at the International Emmy Awards in New York for his performance in the TV series Şahsiyet (Persona) in 2019. 

IV- Haluk Bilginer, a Turkish actor, was born in 1954 in İzmir.

V- After graduating from the Theatre Department at Ankara State Conservatory, Bilginer started to work for the State Theatres.

A) I - II - V - III - IV
B) V- IV - III - II - I
C) II - V - I - IV - III
D) IV - I - V - II - III
E) III - I - II - V - IV
A B C D E
questionText: Order the sentences to make a meaningful paragraph. I- Bilginer first acted in a theater group when he was a high school student, and won his first award at an inter-high school competition in 1970. II- He went to England to study at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts, and from 1980 to 1993, he performed on stage and on TV series in England. III- He won the Best Actor award at the International Emmy Awards in New York for his performance in the TV series Şahsiyet (Persona) in 2019. IV- Haluk Bilginer, a Turkish actor, was born in 1954 in İzmir. V- After graduating from the Theatre Department at Ankara State Conservatory, Bilginer started to work for the State Theatres. A) I - II - V - III - IV B) V- IV - III - II - I C) II - V - I - IV - III D) IV - I - V - II - III E) III - I - II - V - IV A B C D E
question:
Order the sentences to make a meaningful paragraph.

I- Bilginer first acted in a theater group when he was a high school student, and won his first award at an inter-high school competition in 1970.
II- He went to England to study at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts, and from 1980 to 1993, he performed on stage and on TV series in England.
III- He won the Best Actor award at the International Emmy Awards in New York for his performance in the TV series Şahsiyet (Persona) in 2019.
IV- Haluk Bilginer, a Turkish actor, was born in 1954 in İzmir.
V- After graduating from the Theatre Department at Ankara State Conservatory, Bilginer started to work for the State Theatres.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 29158

Choose the correct statement to complete the sentence according to the paragraph below. 

Hi, I’m Jeremy. I went to Walt Disney World in Orlando, Florida with my family last summer. It was my favourite vacation. It was a long trip. Since my mother was afraid of flying, we travelled by my dad’s camper. There are four main parks at Walt Disney World: The Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and Animal Kingdom. We went on attractions in these theme parks and I had lots of fun. We went on rides with my dad and siblings. We went on Splash Mountain and rode on logs. We went through a tunnel. At the end of the tunnel, everyone got wet. It was a breath-taking experience for me. At the theme parks, we saw different Disney characters. Dad took many photos of me with them. At Epcot Centre, we watched spectacular fireworks show and had fun. The shows were amazing and the land itself was so pretty. This was one of the most unforgettable vacation for all of us and we were contented with being there.

As Jeremy’s mom was afraid of planes, ...... .

A) they had to go by plane
B) it was Jeremy’s favourite vacation
C) they preferred going there by a camper
D) they decided to stay in a hostel one night
E) they went through many tunnels on the way
A B C D E

A) Because of its cold weather, Aslı couldn’t get used to living in Ankara B) Although she didn’t want to move to Ankara, now she is happy there C) If she had a chance, she would move to Antalya without thinking even a second D) Her friends and teachers helped her to get used to living in Ankara, but she never wanted E) As they moved to Ankara because of his father's job, she got angry with him A B C D E
question:
Aslı: “Last year, we decided to move to Ankara because my father’s company promoted him as an executive in Ankara office. We moved to a new apartment close to my school, which is located in Batıkent. Actually, in the beginning, I didn’t enjoy living here due to its cold weather and the lack of sea, unlike Antalya. However, with the help of my friends and teachers I got used to living here in a short time. I am glad to live here with warm, hospitable and helpful friends and teachers.”
We can infer from the text that …. .
options: Because of its cold weather, Aslı couldn’t get used to living in Ankara
Although she didn’t want to move to Ankara, now she is happy there
If she had a chance, she would move to Antalya without thinking even a second
Her friends and teachers helped her to get used to living in Ankara, but she never wanted
As they moved to Ankara because of his father's job, she got angry with him

questionAsHtml:

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

In 1582, Pope Gregory XIII adjusted the calendar. He changed the date March 25th which was traditionally celebrated as the New Year's Day. Since then, January 1st has been adopted to be the New Year's Day worldwide. But in China, New Year is based on the lunar calendar so the date actually changes from year to year between January and February 21st depending on when the new moon of the first lunar month falls. On the other hand, Ethiopian New Year, also called Enkutatash, meaning the 'gift of jewels' is celebrated on September 11th, at the end of the big rains.

It is stated in the passage that March 25th ... .

A) used to be the date when people celebrated new year  
B) is still celebrated as the new year 
C) was Pope Gregory XIII's birthday 
D) is an important day for Chinese culture 
E) is accepted to be the beginning of lunar calendar
A B C D E

Reporter: Congratulations! We are all proud of you! What made you win the Cup?

Osman Çakmak: We wanted to show what we are capable of to the rest of the world. We believed in ourselves and played so ambitiously that we were able to be the champion.

Reporter: And you, Barış? What is the secret behind it?

B) We weren’t ambitious enough to win the match; I hope we can do it next time
C) I’ve never given up on my dream of becoming a footballer, and now I’m living my dream
D) Most of the players were injured and as a result we couldn’t win the match
E) As a result, I gave up football because it is also important to know when to give up
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15315

     Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

      The Women’s National Basketball Association (WNBA) was established in 1996 but hasn’t come close to matching the popularity of the NBA yet.

      Women began playing basketball in 1892, but they were expected to compete while dressed in floor-length dresses and petticoats. Stanford college banned women’s basketball in 1899 “for the good of the students’ health” and for “the unpleasant publicity accompanying the contests.” Women’s basketball was not regularly played at U.S. high schools and colleges until after the 1972 Title IX law was signed by President Richard Nixon. The law prevents schools from discriminating on the basis of sex and led to the creation of women’s sports teams (including basketball) in colleges and high schools throughout the United States. The game that began with two peach baskets and a soccer ball in a gymnasium in Massachusetts has certainly made its mark on the world.  

Which information is not stated in the passage?

A) After the law was signed in the U.S, women started to play at high schools.
B) The women players had restrictions when they started to compete.
C) Most of the schools used to prevent girls playing in the basketball league.
D) The law signed by Nixon stopped sex discrimination at schools in the US.
E) The women’s basketball association isn’t as popular as NBA league.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15316

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

The head of the physical education department at the International YMCA Training School (now called Springfield College) in Massachusetts, issued a challenge to his graduate students in 1891. He asked them to create a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that could be played in the gymnasium during the winter months. The game was created by 31-year-old Canadian James Naismith required two teams of nine players to face off against one another. To score points for their team, a player had to land a soccer ball into a cardboard box. After the school’s janitor was unable to find cardboard boxes, Naismith used wooden peach baskets and mounted them at each end of the gymnasium. He called his new game basketball, and wooden baskets were used until 1903 when a Rhode Island company developed an iron hoop with an attached net.

Who was the game of basketball created by?

A) school’s janitor
B) James Naismith
C) graduate students
D) Rhode company
E) two teams
A B C D E

question:
Answer the following question according to the paragraph.
The head of the physical education department at the International YMCA Training School (now called Springfield College) in Massachusetts, issued a challenge to his graduate students in 1891. He asked them to create a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that could be played in the gymnasium during the winter months. The game was created by 31-year-old Canadian James Naismith required two teams of nine players to face off against one another. To score points for their team, a player had to land a soccer ball into a cardboard box. After the school’s janitor was unable to find cardboard boxes, Naismith used wooden peach baskets and mounted them at each end of the gymnasium. He called his new game basketball, and wooden baskets were used until 1903 when a Rhode Island company developed an iron hoop with an attached net.
Who was the game of basketball created by?

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15317

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

After an 1892 article about basketball appeared in a magazine, the new sport spread like wildfire throughout the United States. The New York Times wrote an article about its popularity just one year after its invention. In 1936, basketball was introduced as a men’s Olympic event in Berlin, Germany. Teams from 23 countries competed in games played in an outdoor tennis stadium, and the United States played in the rain to win the gold medal. Despite the game’s ongoing popularity in the United States, low fan attendance plagued professional men’s basketball for most of its history. For that reason, Naismith’s original rules were modified on numerous occasions to make the game more exciting and appealing to fans. Even after two leagues merged to form the 17-team National Basketball Association (NBA) in 1949, the future of the sport was questionable. It wasn’t until 1980 when games were regularly broadcast on cable television, that basketball’s popularity exploded. 

How did basketball become very popular around the world?

A) When it appeared in the Olympic event in Berlin, it gained popularity.
B) After the original rules were changed, the game became very popular.
C) The sport spread its popularity when the NBA merged.
D) When games started to be broadcasted on TV, its popularity increased.
E) After an article in a magazine, the game became very popular.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15318

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

There were no rules during the first-ever game of basketball, and Naismith said it turned into a “free for all” and that he was “afraid the players would kill each other.” One player was knocked out, one dislocated his shoulder, and several ended up with black eyes. The students were eager to play again, but Naismith wouldn’t allow it until he drafted a set of 13 game rules. Players were prohibited from running with the ball but were allowed to throw it or beat it with their hands. This kept them from tackling each other and reduced the risk of injury. Dribbling was introduced in 1901, and by that time players were using a specially designed basketball manufactured by the Spalding Company.

Why did Naismith need to set rules for the game?

A) Because players were afraid to play it.
B) Because many players were injured in the game.
C) Because players weren’t allowed to carry the ball.
D) Because players were careful during the game.
E) Because players didn’t want to take risks.
A B C D E

'Thumb tribe' or sometimes 'thumb generation' is a term used to describe a younger generation with members who are more adept at texting using their thumbs than talking on the phone. It identifies a trend among young people who use mobile phones for many activities, such as texting, e-mail, entertainment, and conversations, as opposed to using keyboards with traditional desktop computers. Without any hesitation, they always send e-mails to their friends from their mobile phones using only one hand.

The reason why it is called 'Thumb Generation' is that ...... .

B) they have grown up in a world that is absolutely different from the one we lived in
C) thumb generation's communication way depends on using thumbs for texting messages
D) because thumb's communication way depends on writing e-mails on the Net
E) thumb's communication way depends on talking face to face
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15245

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

In 1582, Pope Gregory XIII adjusted the calendar. He changed the date March 25th which was traditionally celebrated as the New Year's Day. Since then, January 1st has been adopted to be the New Year's Day worldwide. But in China, New Year is based on the lunar calendar so the date actually changes from year to year between January and February 21st depending on when the new moon of the first lunar month falls. On the other hand, Ethiopian New Year, also called Enkutatash, meaning the 'gift of jewels' is celebrated on September 11th, at the end of the big rains.

According to the text, the new year celebrations ...... .

A) take place at the same time all over the world 
B) haven't changed much throughout the history 
C) vary from culture to culture 
D) have nothing in common among the cultures 
E) were invented by Pope Gregory XIII
A B C D E

Some of them say that they are addicted to their mobile phones and the internet while others say that talking face to face is better than talking online. There are also those who say they cannot live without the internet.

C) Social Media
D) Talking Face to Face is Better

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53550

Choose the best option for the situation given below.

One of your friends feels depressed nowadays. You know that she may need help, but she doesn't share her feelings with you. So, you want to help her and say:

A) Did you watch the documentary about depression last night?
B) You should try hard to feel better; otherwise, you will get worse.
C) Why don't you go for a walk and have some fresh air?
D) Would you like to tell me what the problem is?
E) Don’t give up! You will succeed.
A B C D E
